answers.answer: Stupid phone.... I've *called* them and they don't seem worried.
I had this same problem with number 3.  Try compression stockings to help regulate blood pressure.  Good luck
I also had this but it was do to gestational diabetes. Hope you feel better soon!

My mom suggested I might be anemic, I have a hereditary disease (really hard to explain I'll make it simple) the main symptom is nosebleeds.  I usually get one a day lasting a couple minutes.  Now that I'm pregnant I get several long lasting (5+ mins of steady flow) nosebleeds.  Thus has
I hate my phone!!!! I don't take any extra iron that isn't already in my prenatals.  I'm just worried because I've had family members need transfusions because if this disorder :-( .

Oh man. That sounds brutal. By the sounds of your disease I would say it would probably have something to do with that. You do have extra blood volume while pregnant and dizziness and tiredness has a lot to do with bloodflow usually.At least you see your doc in a couple days!

question: Been having several problems (16 wks) involving dizziness, shakes, cramps, and severe lethargy.  But this is really getting me down. Every time I stand up, no matter how slow, I get really dizzy, then I get a terrible headache that'll last about twenty minutes.  Then I feel completely exhausted like I need to lay down.  This is nothing like my last pregnancy, it was cake!  I can't even clean half a sink of dishes before getting out of breath and have to sit down!  I went grocery shopping yesterday and got dizzy and exhausted walking for less than ten minutes!  And I usually can walk about three miles before I need to sit for a second.  I had to lean on my cart and an end cap to take a break.  I was so short of breath and tired. :-(  I know this can't be normal.  I see my ob on the 21st, I've balked then and they
title: Making me frustrated...
